meanings.definition: The universe considered as a whole, the entire complex structure of something.
meanings.sent1: In some cultures, people believe that the stars and planets make up the macrocosms.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the macrocosms to understand the vastness of the universe.
meanings.sent3: When the aliens visited Earth, they were amazed by our tiny macrocosms compared to theirs.
meanings.sent4: The macrocosms of society can be compared to a giant puzzle with many pieces.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the macrocosms of the ocean depths reveals incredible diversity.

meanings.definition: A large system regarded as a whole.
meanings.sent1: The economy can be seen as a macrocosms of interconnected industries.
meanings.sent2: The ecosystem is a delicate macrocosms that relies on balance.
meanings.sent3: In the world of fashion, each designer brand is a unique macrocosms.
meanings.sent4: The macrocosms of a city can be chaotic yet fascinating.
meanings.sent5: The school functions as a microcosm within the larger macrocosms of education.
